description: Two temples near Cheltenham on the valley-side by the river Coln. The former (Wycomb 1) is an earlier rectangular 'shrine', the later (Wycomb 2) is built over an earlier rectangular shrine. Lewis (1966) suggests that Wycomb 2 was constructed in the late 3rd CE and fell out of use in the early 5th CE.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Wycomb (Syreford Mill).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.

“Thursday, November 26th, 1863.” Proceedings of the Society of Antiquaries of London 2 (1864): 302.

Tsontchef. “Notes Sur Quelques Témoins Matériels de La Culture Romaine En Bulgarie.” Latomus 28 (1957): 465.
